page.title: 01CONCISE GENERAL REVIEW
page.content:
The area consists of gently undulating chalkland with small scattered streams. As there is little in the way of housing, industries and roads, the landscape consists of mixed woods, grassland and arable farmland.
The area has just two villages - Chawton and Farringdon. In both villages the housing styles vary from thatched dwellings several hundred years old upto modern homes. Modern development is extremely limited as both villages are in designated conservation areas where strict planning laws apply.
